reporting-org.narrative: UTZ - joined forces with Rainforest Alliance

title.narrative: Building capacities for sector change: country program Uganda

description.narrative: In 2020 we will have strengthened the lobby and advocacy capacity of civil society organizations in Uganda on productivity, gender and child labor. As a result we will see an improvement of policy environment (both government and companies) and support services in these countries related to these themes. These themes are: 1. Sustainable productivity Raising smallholder productivity in a sustainable way is a key component of sector transformation. It is needed to increase income of the farmer and increase production while lowering the environmental footprint. 2. Women’s empowerment and gender The goal is to increase the inclusion of women in certification and access to benefits as well as to reduce discrimination and violence against women.3. Child labor The focus is on prevention, monitoring and remediation of child labor.
SP-UGA Building capacities for sector change: country program Uganda

title.narrative: Country Scan

description.narrative: During the first part of the inception phase of the program (December 2015-March 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff, carried out a deeper analysis of the sector(s) and themes proposed for their countries to develop a more focused approach for the SP program. The objective of the Country Scans was “to provide a situational analysis on each sector and theme per country assessing the current state with regards to the relevant thematic SP objectives, clearly formulating the causes of the problem that need addressing and identify opportunities for interventions and provide recommendations on potential partners for these interventions.” The Country Scan documents are based on our own experience in the countries, but also document review, conversations/interviews with experts, key informants including Dutch embassy staff, national and international organizations, and workshop results with many of these actors.

title.narrative: # of country scans

comment.narrative: 2 country scans are completed (1 for Uganda and 1 for Ethiopia)
10-01-2018: 2 country scans completed (1 for Uganda and 1 for Ethiopia)

title.narrative: Country Plan

description.narrative: During the second part of the inception phase of the program (April-July 2016) UTZ Country Representatives / SP focal points, supported by external consultants and UTZ Amsterdam staff in drafting the country plans. The purpose of the SP country program plan is to set out a strategic direction for sector change in the country and serves as a framework. This plan clearly states UTZ goals for the country the Theory of Change to guide interventions as well as the budget for said activities. Overall, the SP Country Plan will serve as a guide for the next years, as well as a basis for the year plans that will be formulated for 2017 to 2020.

title.narrative: # of country plans

comment.narrative: 1 country plan is completed for Uganda
10-01-2018: 1 country plan completed for Uganda

title.narrative: Ultimate Outcome 1: Improved inclusion of the voice of female and male smallholders and workers

description.narrative: Improved inclusion of the voice of female and male smallholders and workers in policy/law-making processes

title.narrative: DD3 # of more inclusive policy/law-making processes

description.narrative: Voices, needs and interests of male and female farmers, smallholders and workers are better included in the development of policies and services

comment.narrative: 29-04-2019: 1. UTZ lobbied for and was granted a place at the Uganda coffee platform which sits every months to dicuss key issues in the coffee sector participated in 4 meetings at the NSC 2. AWIC are advocating for women issues at national platform level (National Coffee Steering Committee)

29-04-2020: 1. UCDA invited Cafe Africa Uganda to be part of the Technical Working Group (TWG) developing the Clonal Robusta Coffee Nursery Manual 2. Acting director National children authority provided space for stop child labour partnership forum 3. IWCA (international women in coffee alliance-Uganda chapter) now has a more stable and inclusive governance structure. They have better information about the priorities of their members and engage on new platforms 4. National coffee Steering committee Pledged support towards L&A campaigns on coffee productivity improvement of smallholder coffee farmers 5. Farmer Leaders have commited to be involved in the lobby and advocacy campaign for genuine fertilizer at smallholder level

29-04-2021: 1. Mityana women have held 3 meetings one with agricultural officers to discuss disease issues, they engaged with NEFIMA to discuss access to finance, the women of Kapchorwa hosted the Australian Ambasador and discussed market access 2. NUCAFE managed to engage with the National Fertilizer Committee who pledged to work and collaborate with NUCAFE in regard to fertilizer access and involving us on the national fertilizer committee 3. Crop Protection Department Promised to collaborate with NUCAFE in terms of capacity building of the farmer leaders in safe fertilizer use, handling,distribution for productivity improvement at farm level. They started with one training session where they built capacity of 35 farmer leaders including NUCAFE staff and certificates were awarded. 4. UCDA committed to incorporate asection on the need for soil testing and right fertilizer use in the new national coffee sustainability curiculum which is currently being developed as one of the ways to weed out the chronic blind fertilizer application 5. Parliamentary Committee committed to include in the coffee law a close pushing the ministry to critically tackle the issue of productivity improvement at smallholder farmer level as projectile to drive the 20 million bags by 2030 this came after submitting our views and input on the proposed draft bill and the clerk promised to come back to us with full detail on the progress

29-04-2020: Report on findings from the seedlings survival project pilot implemented by Café Africa were produced and documented.

29-04-2021: 1. CURAD was recently awarded a project by Food & Agricultural Organization (FAO) through which they will lead implementation of the advocacy agenda scaling it up from the RA project. In this project, CURAD will also be hosting the national youth coffee days while they continue working with MAAIF, UCDA, private sector and higher institutions of learning

title.narrative: # of POs/CSOs/unions that use the evidence from research products to advocate for improved services or wages

comment.narrative: tbu

29-04-2019: UTZ & partners are sharing pilots at events (AFCA) and national coffee platform (NCS)
Café Africa shared best practices from pilot at the CT expo in sept, 2018
Child labor documentary was screened at AFCA

29-04-2020: 1. Evidence from the seedlings survival project used in lobbying stakeholders at regional and national platforms. The seedlings project results were used to lobby District officials to make changes in the process and manner of seedlings distributuion and farm management. 2. the child labour study in westnile. The evidence from the child labour studies was used to lobby stakeholders at national level to improve school infrastructure and post labour officers in the westnile districts.

29-04-2021: 1. CURAD was recently awarded a project by Food & Agricultural Organization (FAO) through which they will lead implementation of the advocacy agenda scaling it up from the RA project. In this project, CURAD will also be hosting the national youth coffee days while they continue working with MAAIF, UCDA, private sector and higher institutions of learning

title.narrative: Ultimate Outcome 2: Policy changes & implementation

description.narrative: Policies are better in line with the needs of female and male farmers, smallholders and workers; Adequate implementation of policies;

title.narrative: DD1 # of ((inter)national) standards and policies implemented

description.narrative: Adequate implementation of policies

comment.narrative: 29-04-2019: Child labor: Increased enrolment in schools; Commitment of districts, Sub Counties leadership in supporting the fight against Child Labour • Nacori is engaged in project implementation of the seedlings project at district level • A separate committee to check fertilizer issues initiated at the coffee platform level and RA is a member

29-04-2020: 1. Child Labor policy: 1.1 Director of labour MGLSD: Mr wandera appointed principal labour officer to be part of the project. The principal labour officer has committed to support the project and to follow up with districts without labour officers 1.2 child labour committees engage communities on child protection isuues, mobilize families and conduct dialogues with community to take back their children in school 1.3. Coffee companies adopted Child labour eradication strategies in their operations (supply chains) in Nebbi and Zombo 2. Seedling distribution policy: 2.1. The Oversight Committee (OSC)developed the Nursery and Post nursery trainers guide with information on coffee seedlings management 2.2. Ibanda and Isingiro District Coffee Steering Committee (DCSC) and DLGs participated in the project for practical evidence generation on seedlings survival 2.3. NCSC/TWG, based on the Seedlings trainers guide, decided to develop the Clonal Robusta Coffee Nursery Manual 2.4. UCDA –MD Formally wrote to the CAOs of the 9 DLGs (district leaders) introducing the project, & requesting to embrace it & offer support 2.5. All 9 project (Iganga, Mayuge, Kamuli, Luwero, Mityana, Bukomansimbi, Isingiro, Ibanda and Rubirizi) districts Headquarters formally accepted to welcome & support the project in their respective districts 2.6. UCDA-MD directed Regional Coffee Extension Officers (RCEO) & Regional Managers (RM) to provide technical support during the project trainings 2.7. Non State Actors (NSAs) -(private sector) committed their staff to participate in the hand books project training 2.8 LCV/District Political Leadership have committed to have the updated H/Bks uploaded on the respective district websites

29-04-2021: 1. Community Development Officers and Social Protection & Welfare Officers are supervising of work places and Black spot monitoring and inspection of child labour cases identification and remediation 2. Department of Labour increased budget allocation to child labour issues from 2 Million that was allocated in 2017/18 to about 5 Million in 2018/19. 3. Commissioner of Labour wrote letters to all districts including Zombo to prioritise employing district labour officers. This increased the labour officers from 36 in 2018 to 90 by Feb 2020.

title.narrative: DD2 # of policy changes that UTZ /partners contributed to

description.narrative: Policies are better in line with the needs of (female) smallholders, (female) farmers and (female) farm workers, based on their needs and interests

comment.narrative: 29-04-2019: Change of norms/attitude towards child labor (Teachers, pupils, PTAs, Communities, Local leaders, Parents) • At National level there is an oversight committee overseeing the district committees that support decisions of seedling distribution (these committees consist of the former contact person for government but this time trained and streamlined to check mortality issues

29-04-2020: 1. Nucafe provided input into the draft national coffee bill that is now before parliament. 2. Secretary social services erussi: Hon Laka Adams drafted by-law on child labour 3. ILO, the UN's International Labour organisation, adopted the approaches of RA's child labour projects in its new interventions in Uganda 4. UCDA shifting focus from distribution of Elite coffee to distribution of CWDr varieties after CAU shared outcomes of the seedlings project with NCSC/UCDA
29-04-2021: 1. MGLSD approved and gazzetted the National Action Plan on elimination of Child labour with elimination of child labour in Agriculture was included as a priority.

Study on child protection policies (national level) and hots spot areas in coffee. Pilot on Child labour eradication in coffee in Zombo; Baseline study on soil and nutrient requirements for fertiliser access(soil and more & Nucafe)

18-07-2019: Coffee seedlings: OWC: Timely delivery of coffee seedlings to farmers, Joint planning with stakeholders (Aos, NOPs, Parish chiefs, CBFs, Farmers); Nursery Operators Sell quality seedlings, Train farmers at the demo plot before distributing/selling seedlings to them

29-04-2020: 1. MAAIF (ministry of Agriculture) has expressed willingness to communicate to DLGs (CAO’s) to integrate the new information from Cafe Africa Uganda in the updated coffee nursery handbooks. THis will help adoption & implementation of the Information in the updated handbooks by the DLGs (district level).
29-04-2021: 1. TUTON asked CAU to have their agronomists trained under the Handbooks project

title.narrative: Baseline Report

description.narrative: The baseline provides an elaborate context-analysis per country, containing details about capacity of partners and the current state regarding the thematic goals for L&A. The baseline focuses on three main areas: a. Description of baseline situation of context and stakeholders b. Baseline of outcomes of ToC c. Capacities assessment

title.narrative: DD3 # of issues brought forward by UTZ, partners and MSPs included in the agenda of public and private policy makers

description.narrative: Agenda setting

comment.narrative: tbu
29-04-2019: Café Africa: prioritization of seedling survival (on Research agenda) by Nacori

29-04-2020: 1. The access to genuine fetilisers issues and 2. the issue of child labour in west nile were key issues discussed at policy level in the first and second quarter. They were discussed at the coffee platform and national child labour platforms respectively. 3. Parliamentary committee of agriculture Comittment will push for budgetary allocations to enable the implementation of the national coffee policy possibly in the next financial yeary campaign for genuine fertilizer. 4. Uganda National Input dealers Association (UNADA)commit to collaborate on building capacity of farmers in the fertilizer use and handling 5. Directorate of extension comitted to build capacity of farmers in soil sampling- related to genuine fertlizer work;

title.narrative: DD3 # of advocacy messages and evidence used in political statements, policies, plans/media items by stakeholders

description.narrative: Discursive change

comment.narrative: tbu
29-04-2019: UTZ/RA: Ministry of Agriculture (MAAIF) Made a statement on child labour campaign at AFCA conference 2. Nucafe: MAAIF is making policy statements on fertilizer use

29-04-2020: 1. Child labour messages from erusi subcounty were taken up at the District by the District authorities especially the District Education Officer who invited the Minister to come and Visit. 2. Messages from UTZ partner Somero were used at the International Day against child labour as key theme messages for the event. 3. NUCAFE advocacy campaigns on the coffee bill were published in media, additionally there is progress documentation of projects in documentaries that will be used as evidence in dialogues 4. church leader Fr John Bosco included child labour and child protection isues in his sermons 5. State minister for education and sports (MOES) Hon bakabulindi charles committed to support elimiation of child labour 6. LC3 chairperson Erussi: Hon Jalacida collines commited to development of child labour by-law 7. State minister for primary education (MOES). Hon Rose seninde committed to support elimiation of child labour 8. The acting director NCA (National Children's Authority)picked interest in the project and committed to support the project agenda at the National Steering Committee 9.Senior probation and social welfare officer committed to sensitize the community on child labour, teenage pregnancy and early marriages and good parenting

29-04-2021: 1. UCDA Accepted CAU to coordinate implementation of the updated Robusta and Arabica coffee production handbooks in Uganda 2. Uganda Parliamentary Forum on Quality Education committed to support Elimination of Child labour 3. Media houses: Increased documentation and sharing of child labour best practices on local radio stations with public on radio Paidha and Maria 4.Fast and improved handling of Domestic violence cases by probation officers 5. coffee business announces inclusion and adoption of child protection measures in all their operations 6. Child labour monitoring structures increase and improve documentition and reporting of child labour issues 7. Attitude change and commitment to support child labour identification and remediation in Global coffee supply chain by coffee roasters 8. Parents increased support, participation and engagement in school project . This was demonstrated through increased support towards their children education through paying school fees and provision of locally avialable food, construction materials and security etc 9. Parents and Teachers Association & Board of Governance have improved capacity of school governance structures to handle conflicts and grievances with parents and community members like land conflicts 10. Improved voice and representation of secondary schools in sub-county education plans 11. District Community Development Officer submitted a letter to the Chielf Administartive Officer (CAO) requesting for the recruitment of the district Labour officer. 12. The commissioner of crop and animal husbandry committed to support and present the identified child labour issues to the management committee of MAIF. 13. The commissioner in charge of primary education in the Ministry of Education committed to communicate to district Education officers to integrate monitoring of identification of children affected by child labour during their school monitoring visits. 14. The education officers in the Ministry of ...

title.narrative: DD3 # of requests received by UTZ and partners from different stakeholders (governments, companies, CSOs, etc) to provide input for policy making

description.narrative: Stakeholders ask and use UTZ knowledge, experience, tools for policy development and implementation (incl sourcing practices)

comment.narrative: tbu.
29-04-2019: UTZ was asked to contribute to the development of manuals for the coffee sector ( UTZ was part techical worksing gorup that apprasied the coffee handbook developed by UCDA)

29-04-2020: 1. Somero Uganda was invited to review the 10 year International Action Plan. 2. During the drafting of the National Children’s policy, Ministry of Gender Labour and Social Development invited Somero to give feedback on the draft policy. 3. Child labour steering committees in Erusi participated in the development of ordinances against child labour at the subcounty council. 4. NUCAFE was invited to input in the coffee bill, they attended 3 meetings with the parliamentary committee to dialogue on issues of farmer registration and licencing among others.

29-04-2021: 1. The national Child Labour platforms invited RA to participate in several national child protection and child labour platforms 2.Based on the Seedlings trainers guide to develop the Clonal Robusta Coffee Nursery Manual, CAU was invited to be part of the Technical Working Group (TWG) developing the Clonal Robusta Coffee Nursery Manual as a result of experience from the seedlings project

title.narrative: # and type of structural collaborations with gov., private sector, other standards, CSOs etc.

comment.narrative: N/A
18-07-2019: 1. AWIC has relations with new partners (Draft MoU with UCDA, EEA/USAID partnership UEF 2. UTZ /RA new CSO, government and private sector partners on child labor and productivity

29-04-2020: NUCAFE participated as key proponent of changes and ammendments to the national coffee bill now before parliament. SOMERO has used its seat at the national children's platforms to table evidence from the child labour projects and push for national action to address the causes of child labour in the coffee growing region.

title.narrative: DD3 # and type of panel discussions/ speaking opportunies

comment.narrative: N/A
18-07-2019: 1. International Coffee Day (AFCA); participated in a panel 2. We supported the first annual coffee power talk targeting youth participation

29-04-2020: 1) RA was invited to participate in events like the ILO Child labour project launch where the agenda of RA/UTZ was highlighted. 2)Child labour partners participated in the international day against child labour where UTZ was recorngised as a key partner by Government. 3-5) RA was also invited to speak at 3 forums of the national child labour steering committees where the evidence generated form the stop child labour projects in Zombo were presented and policy makers were urged to take national level action.
